newsitem.title: USA: Officials issue mandatory evacuation for Grand Forks.
newsitem.headline: Officials issue mandatory evacuation for Grand Forks.

text.p: Mandatory evacuation orders were issued Sunday for this North Dakota city ravaged by flood and fire, officials said in a statement.
"The whole city's being evacuated," a police officer told Reuters after being informed of the decision.
"Effective immediately, everybody trying to get into the city of Grand Forks will need a pass," a radio announcer said, reading out the official statement.

This city of approximately 50,000 residents has been ravaged in recent days by flood waters from the swollen Red River and by a fire that has raged through four blocks of the swamped downtown district.
